title: General Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your general knowledge with these fun questions!

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and largest city of France, known for its rich history, art, and landmarks like the Eiffel Tower.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is often called the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance, which is caused by iron oxide (rust) on its surface.

questions.question: Who wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
questions.explanation: Harper Lee wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' a novel published in 1960 that deals with racial injustice in the American South.

questions.question: Which is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean, covering more than 63 million square miles and extending from the Arctic to the Southern Ocean.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: The chemical symbol for gold is 'Au,' derived from the Latin word 'Aurum,' meaning 'shining dawn.'

questions.question: How many continents are there?
questions.explanation: There are seven continents: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Europe, North America, Oceania, and South America.

questions.question: What year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Germany in May and Japan in September after the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

questions.question: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River is the longest river in the world, stretching about 6,650 km (4,130 miles) and flowing through northeastern Africa.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa, one of the most famous artworks in the world, displayed at the Louvre Museum in Paris.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
questions.explanation: Diamond is the hardest natural substance on Earth, formed under extreme pressure and used in cutting tools and jewelry.

questions.question: What does DNA stand for?
questions.explanation: DNA stands for Deoxyribonucleic Acid, the molecule that carries genetic instructions for the development and functioning of all living organisms.

questions.question: How many bones are in the adult human body?
questions.explanation: The adult human body has 206 bones, which provide structure, protect organs, and support movement.

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world, covering about 44 hectares (110 acres) and serving as the headquarters of the Roman Catholic Church.
